extension.dc:title: Plinian Core Extension
extension.name: Plinian Core
extension.dc:subject: plic:Plinian Core; dwc:Taxon
extension.dc:description: Plinian Core is a set of concepts that defines the necessary basic attributes to integrate and recover the information about species of organisms required by users specialized in biodiversity as well as users of other areas. This extension is supposed to be used in addition to the taxon core and the simple images, vernacular names and references extension.

property.name: TaxonRecordID
property.dc:description: Unique identifier of the record within the database.

property.name: GlobalUniqueIdentifier
property.dc:description: An Uniform Resource Name (URN) used as an unique identifier of the taxon record.

property.name: Abstract
property.dc:description: General description of the taxon. This concept could point out any information about the taxon. Its main goal is summarize the most relevant or attractive characteristics of this taxon to the general public.
property.examples: A mottled bluish-grey rorqual which is the largest living animal and reaches lengths of up to 27 m [Balaenoptera musculus].

property.name: Language
property.dc:description: Language used to write the species information, ISO 639-2 according to GBIF Metadata Profile, Reference Guide http://links.gbif.org/gbif_metadata_profile_guide_en_v1.

property.name: AudiencesUnstructured
property.dc:description: Users to which the information is addressed. The defined audiences are: Biodiversity researchers, teachers and students, decision makers, professionals from another areas and general public.This list audience codes has to be separated by means of comma or /.

property.name: SynonymsUnstructured
property.dc:description: Different names for this taxon. This concept is a placeholder field, in block text format

property.name: DetailUnstructured
property.dc:description: Miscellaneous: notes attached to the taxon information. E.g. Pronunciation, etymology...In block text format

property.name: BriefDescription
property.dc:description: Brief description, presented in a simple technical language, to distinguish the species from other close or similar ones.

property.name: FullDescriptionUnstructured
property.dc:description: Complete and detailed account of the taxonomic and systematic characters, e.g. those that define and allow to recognize an organism.

property.name: Keys
property.dc:description: Tool for the identification of organisms, comprising a series of steps, each of which represents a question about one or more characters of the organism. Each step offers multiple alternatives, choosing one of them will lead us to the next step until reaching, finally, the name of the organism. Most of the keys only offer two alternatives, the so called dichotomous keys. A taxon can include an identification key for the subordinate taxa.
property.examples: The register of a genre will include the keys of the species shown in this genre, and the register of a species will include the keys of infra-specific ranks (in the case of plants: subspecies, variety, forms...)

property.name: LifeFormUnstructured
property.dc:description: General appearance. Characteristic mode of growth or occurrence associated to its environment, particularly for plants. Comprising its size, shape, texture and orientation. In block text format

property.name: LifeCycleUnstructured
property.dc:description: Life history of a living organism: The course of developmental changes in an organism from fertilized zygote to maturity or stages through which an organism passes. In block text format.
property.examples: "The fungus fruit body is the spore-producing stage of the life cycle. The spores produced by fruit bodies are usually the result of sexual reproduction. The fruit body is supported by and develops from an extensive network of thread-like filaments called hyphae. Hyphae are often collectively termed the mycelium; the food-absorbing part of the fungus. When conditions are favorable, and the mycelium is at the proper stage of development, fruit bodies are produced by the fungus. The spores produced by a fruit body are released initiate the life cycle anew."

property.name: ReproductionUnstructured
property.dc:description: All data related to the production of offspring. In block text format.

property.name: Event
property.dc:description: An action that occurs at some location during some time. A controlled vocabulary is recommended.

property.name: StartTimeInterval
property.dc:description: The date-time or interval at which an event starts. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E). A controlled vocabulary is recommended.
property.examples: "1963-03-08T14:07-0600" is 8 Mar 1963 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC, "2009-02-20T08:40Z" is 20 Feb 2009 8:40am UTC, "1809-02-12" is 12 Feb 1809, "1906-06" is Jun 1906, "1971" is just that year, "2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z" is the interval between 1 Mar 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC, "2007-11-13/15" is the interval between 13 Nov 2007 and 15 Nov 2007.

property.name: EndTimeInterval
property.dc:description: The date-time or interval at which an event ends. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).A controlled vocabulary is recommended.
property.examples: "1963-03-08T14:07-0600" is 8 Mar 1963 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC, "2009-02-20T08:40Z" is 20 Feb 2009 8:40am UTC, "1809-02-12" is 12 Feb 1809, "1906-06" is Jun 1906, "1971" is just that year, "2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z" is the interval between 1 Mar 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC, "2007-11-13/15" is the interval between 13 Nov 2007 and 15 Nov 2007.

property.name: AnnualCycleUnstructured
property.dc:description: Set of changes or events that recurrently take place at the same time of year and are influenced by seasonal and inter-annual climate variations. For example: reproduction, flowering, fruiting, emergence of insects, etc. Also called phenology, mainly in plants. In the case of migration, refers only to the timing of it; other data about this are gathered in MigratoryData. In block text format.

property.name: FeedingType
property.dc:description: Primary diet source. A controlled vocabulary is recommended.

property.name: TrophicStrategy
property.dc:description: Tactic used to obtain energy or nutrients. A controlled vocabulary is recommended.

property.name: TrophicStrategyRemarks
property.dc:description: Information notes about specific feeding strategies.

property.name: FeedingUnstructured
property.dc:description: Information related to supply food for the development and sustenance of the individual and-or its offspring. In block text format.

property.name: DispersalType
property.dc:description: Means or vector of dispersal. A controlled vocabulary is recommend.

property.name: StructureDispersed
property.dc:description: Mechanism or structure which seeds are dispersed. A controlled vocabulary is recommend.

property.name: DispersalUnstructured
property.dc:description: The permanent spreading of individuals away from each other not including return. Dispersal determines the range over which genetic mixing occurs, and thus, the degree of homogeneity and inbreeding in a population. In block text format.

property.name: BehaviorUnstructured
property.dc:description: Responses, reactions or movements made by an organism in a particular situation. In block text format.

property.name: InteractionSpeciesType
property.dc:description: String with the type of interaction. Each element is seperated by comma and each list of elements by ;. A controlled vocabulary is recommended.

property.name: InteractionUnstructured
property.dc:description: Mutual or reciprocal actions or influences. For example, predation, parasitism, mutualism, etc. Relations with products grown and stored by man (plagues) are also included. In block text format.

property.name: MolecularDataUnstructured
property.dc:description: Information on the chemical structures and biological processes at the molecular level: DNA and proteins sequences, protein structures, expression profiles of genes protein domains, families of genes, mutations, polymorphisms, involvement in disease, ... Undeveloped. Placeholder for connecting with standards developed by specialists. For example, Standards for Data Exchange and Management from Scalalife (http://www.scalalife.eu/content/data.html). In block text format.

property.name: MigratoryUnstructured
property.dc:description: The regular, usually seasonal, movement of all or part of an animal population to and from a given area, which can occur in variable periods of time and even involve more than one generation. In block text format.

property.name: EcologicalSignificanceUnstructured
property.dc:description: Ecological importance of the taxon. (Placeholder). In block text format.

property.name: EnvironmentalEnvelopeUnstructured
property.dc:description: Set of environmental conditions within which it is believed that the species can persist; that is where its environmental requirements can be satisfied. In block text format.
property.examples: Environmental range in which the organism lives (e.g. annual precipitation/average/450/mm)

property.name: WhatImpact
property.dc:description: An indication of the actual impact as a free text string.
property.examples: "Destroys riparian vegetation", "Destroys irrigation systems", "Displaces Arvicola sapidus",...

property.name: Vector
property.dc:description: By which means a species occupies a new territory.

property.name: Route
property.dc:description: This is equivalent and probably replaceable by gisin:route.

property.name: impactTarget
property.dc:description: This is equivalent and probably replaceable by gisin:target

property.name: impactMechanism
property.dc:description: Mechanism of introduction or impact to a new location. This is equivalent and probably replaceable by gisin:impactMechanism.

property.name: InvasivenessUnstructured
property.dc:description: Information about invasive exotic species that could threaten to ecosystem, habitats and species. In block text format

property.name: HabitatUnstructured
property.dc:description: General description of the sites where the species is found (ecosystem, forest, environment or micro-habitat). (Placeholder). In block text format

property.name: DistributionUnstructured
property.dc:description: Comment about the distribution of the species based on information from the collection sites of the studied specimens. In block text format.

property.name: EndemicUnstructured
property.dc:description: Organism that lives exclusively in a particular territory and not found anywhere else. In block text format.

property.name: TerritoryUnstructured
property.dc:description: Information associated mostly to vertebrates, referring to the territorial extension of the individual or group in terms of its activities (feeding, mating, etc.). In block text format.

property.name: PopulationBiologyUnstructured
property.dc:description: Study of the variations in time and space as well as size and density of populations, and the factors that cause such variations. In block text format.

property.name: ThreatStatusUnstructured
property.dc:description: Information about the status of the taxon. In block text format.

property.name: DirectThreatUnstructured
property.dc:description: VCR. Direct threats are the proximate human activities or processes that have caused, are causing, or may cause the destruction, degradation, and/or impairment of biodiversity targets (e.g., unsustainable fishing or logging). Direct threats are synonymous with sources of stress and proximate pressures. Threats can be past (historical), ongoing, and/or likely to occur in the future. In block text format.

property.name: LegislationUnstructured
property.dc:description: A national proposed law or group of laws. A regional proposed law or group of laws. In block text format.

property.name: UsesUnstructured
property.dc:description: Ways in which species are utilized by people. Including Folklore. In block text format.

property.name: ManagementAndConservationUnstructured
property.dc:description: Management: actions directed at conserving or restoring species / Conservation: interventions undertaken designed to preserve species. In block text format.
